text: In the above HTML page (http://www.infoworld.com/eric/new_article/hp_bad_ssi.html), part of the code is like this: ===================================================================== This line ends at 7997,and the comment line start at 7998 ===================================================================== The page broke at the first SSI command. I then traced it up and found that the comment line "",which starts at character count from head 7998, caused the problem. I duplicated the page by removing one character before comment line (http://www.infoworld.com/eric/new_article/hp_bad_ssi_fixed_by_remove_char.html ), by replacing the first character of comment line "<" to "-" (http://www.infoworld.com/eric/new_article/hp_bad_ssi_fixed_by_remove_comment.h tml ) then both pages renders correctly. For some reason, there is a glitch and I am not sure what exactly it is. I only know the next SSI breaks when there is a comment line before it and the comment line starts >= 7998 in this case. Could you please help us find out what actually causes the problem? Thanks! Chris Lin

text:
The problem is mod_include, which is (hopefully) fixed in 2.0.49. There's a
patch against 2.0.48, which can be found here:
<http://cvs.apache.org/~nd/ssi-redesign-r2-2.0.48.patch>

Good luck!
If it still occurs in 2.0.49 (comming out soon), please reopen the report. Thanks!
